```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

movies <- read.csv("data/movies_metadata.csv", sep = ",", header = T)

# movies[,"profit"] <-  as.numeric(movies[,"revenue"]) - as.numeric(movies[,"budget"])
# #inflation rate (as estimated by tradingeconomics.com) is ~3.26% over the last 100 years
# movies[,"inflation_profit"] <-  as.numeric(movies[,"revenue"]) - as.numeric(movies[,"budget"]) * 0.0326
# movies[,"inflation_revenue"] <- as.numeric(movies[,]$revenue) * 0.0326
# movies[,"inflation_budget"] <- as.numeric(movies[,]$budget) * 0.0326
for (i in 1:3){
  year <- as.POSIXct(movies[i,"release_date"], format = "%Y-%m-%d")
  year <- as.numeric(format(year, format="%m"))
  #divides movies 2000s and 1900s by adding the correct year amount
  if(0 <= year || year <= 22){
    year <- year + 2000
  }else{
    year <- year + 1900
  }
  #calculating total inflation to be used by multiplying average year inflation rate * (difference in 2022 and year movie was released)
   #inflation rate (as estimated by tradingeconomics.com) is ~3.26% over the last 100 years
  inflation <- ((2022-year)* 0.0326)
  #extracing profit/budget/revenue 
  revenue <- as.numeric(movies[i,]$revenue)
  budget <- as.numeric(movies[i,]$budget)
  profit<- revenue - budget
  #putting new values into the correct column
  movies[i,"profit"] <- profit
  movies[i,"inflation_profit"] <- profit + profit * inflation
  movies[i,"inflation_revenue"] <- revenue + revenue * inflation
  movies[i,"inflation_budget"] <-  budget + budget * inflation
  movies$isEN <- ifelse(movies$original_language == "en", 1, 0)
  movies$isCollection <- ifelse(movies$belongs_to_collection == "", 0, 1)

}
print(paste0("The total profit for movies: $", movies[1, "profit"]))
print(paste0("The total profit for movies, adjusted for inflation was: $", movies[1, "inflation_profit"]))
```
